events.originalText: Two Chinese cargo ships were attacked on a stretch of the Mekong River in the Golden Triangle area of Southeast Asia, and their crews murdered.
events.subtitle: Mekong River massacre
events.headline: Chinese cargo ships attacked in Golden Triangle area, crews murdered

events.originalText: Two Chinese cargo ships were attacked and their crews murdered on a stretch of the Mekong River in far northern Thailand.
events.subtitle: Mekong River massacre
events.headline: Chinese cargo ships attacked in far northern Thailand, crews murdered

events.originalText: Two trains collided head-on at Ladbroke Grove, London, killing 31 people, injuring 417, and severely damaging public confidence in the management and regulation of safety of Britain's privatised railway system.
events.subtitle: Ladbroke Grove rail crash
events.headline: 31 killed in head-on train collision at Ladbroke Grove, London

events.originalText: Two trains collided head-on in Ladbroke Grove, London, killing 31 people, injuring 417, and severely damaging public confidence in the management and regulation of safety of Britain's privatised railway system.
events.subtitle: Ladbroke Grove rail crash
events.headline: 31 killed in Ladbroke Grove train collision, public confidence damaged

events.originalText: During the United States vice-presidential debate, Democratic candidate Lloyd Bentsen told his opponent Dan Quayle, "Senator, you're no Jack Kennedy."
events.subtitle: Lloyd Bentsen
events.headline: Bentsen tells Quayle 'You're no Jack Kennedy' in VP debate

events.originalText: Eugene Hasenfus's plane was shot down by Nicaraguan forces while carrying weapons to the Contra rebels on behalf of the U.S. government; he was subsequently captured, leading to an international controversy.
events.subtitle: Eugene Hasenfus
events.headline: Nicaraguan forces shoot down Hasenfus's plane carrying weapons

events.originalText: Dirty War: The Argentine guerrilla group Montoneros carried out Operation Primicia, a terrorist attack in which they hijacked an Aerolíneas Argentinas flight, captured Formosa International Airport, and attacked a military regiment.
events.subtitle: Dirty War
events.headline: Montoneros hijack flight in Operation Primicia terrorist attack

events.originalText: Seven nations signed the European Patent Convention, providing an autonomous legal system according to which European patents are granted.
events.subtitle: European Patent Convention
events.headline: Seven nations sign European Patent Convention

events.originalText: The environmental organization Greenpeace was incorporated as the Don't Make a Wave Committee in British Columbia, Canada.
events.subtitle: Greenpeace
events.headline: Greenpeace founded as Don't Make a Wave Committee in Canada

events.originalText: The environmental organization Greenpeace was incorporated as the Don't Make a Wave Committee in British Columbia, Canada.
events.subtitle: Greenpeace
events.headline: Greenpeace founded as Don't Make a Wave Committee in Canada

events.originalText: The U.S. suspended the Commercial Import Program, its main economic support for South Vietnam, in response to the oppression of Buddhists by President Ngô Đình Diệm (pictured).
events.subtitle: Commercial Import Program
events.headline: U.S. suspends economic support for South Vietnam over Buddhist oppression

events.originalText: "Love Me Do", the first single by the Beatles, was released in the United Kingdom.
events.subtitle: Love Me Do
events.headline: Beatles release first single 'Love Me Do' in UK

events.originalText: Dr. No, the first James Bond film, was released.
events.subtitle: Dr. No (film)
events.headline: First James Bond film 'Dr. No' released

events.originalText: Around 200 men began a 291-mile (468 km) march from Jarrow to London, carrying a petition to the British government requesting the re-establishment of industry in the town.
events.subtitle: Jarrow March
events.headline: Men begin march from Jarrow to London for industry re-establishment

events.originalText: Samuel Griffith (pictured) became the first Chief Justice of Australia, while Edmund Barton and Richard O'Connor became the first Puisne Justices of the High Court of Australia.
events.subtitle: Samuel Griffith
events.headline: Samuel Griffith becomes first Chief Justice of Australia

events.originalText: During construction of the Eastman tunnel in St. Anthony, Minnesota (now Minneapolis), the Mississippi River broke through the tunnel's limestone ceiling, nearly destroying Saint Anthony Falls.
events.subtitle: Eastman tunnel
events.headline: Mississippi River breaks through Eastman tunnel in St. Anthony

events.originalText: During construction of the Eastman tunnel in St. Anthony, Minnesota (now Minneapolis), the Mississippi River broke through the tunnel's limestone ceiling, nearly destroying Saint Anthony Falls.
events.subtitle: Eastman tunnel
events.headline: Mississippi River breaks through Eastman tunnel in St. Anthony

events.originalText: French Revolution: Upset about the high price and scarcity of bread, thousands of Parisian women and allies marched on the Palace of Versailles.
events.subtitle: French Revolution
events.headline: Parisian women march on Versailles over bread scarcity

events.originalText: The Treaty of Zamora (pictured) established Portugal as a kingdom independent of the Kingdom of León.
events.subtitle: Treaty of Zamora
events.headline: Treaty of Zamora establishes Portugal as independent kingdom

events.originalText: The Fourth Council of Constantinople, the eighth Catholic Ecumenical Council, was convened to discuss the patriarchate of Photios I of Constantinople.
events.subtitle: Fourth Council of Constantinople (Catholic Church)
events.headline: Fourth Council of Constantinople convened to discuss patriarchate

events.originalText: Heraclius was crowned Byzantine emperor, having personally beheaded his predecessor, Phocas.
events.subtitle: Heraclius
events.headline: Heraclius crowned Byzantine emperor after beheading predecessor
